lines.content: Shrimp is a fast and lightweight task manager designed to keep you organized without getting in your way. Whether you need to keep track of tasks, manage deadlines, or get reminders, Shrimp has you covered.
- **Simple and intuitive interface**: No flashy UIâ€”just type and go.
- **Fast and responsive**: Add and manage tasks without delay.
- **Perfect for Java learners**: Shrimp is an ideal tool for those looking to enhance their Java programming skills.
1. **Download** the latest release version of Shrimp from [here](https://github.com/RadieonAjax/ip/releases).
3. Start adding tasks by typing commands like `add`, `mark`, `delete`, etc.
4. Manage your tasks and let Shrimp take care of the details!
- **Add support for Deadline, Event and Todo**
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/shrimp/gui/Launcher.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Launcher.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE).
Stay tuned for more features to come!

Welcome to the Shrimp chatbot! This guide will help you navigate the commands available to manage your tasks effectively. Shrimp is designed to assist you with managing your to-do list, setting deadlines, scheduling events, and more.

Shrimp is a fast and lightweight task manager designed to keep you organized without getting in your way. Whether you need to keep track of tasks, manage deadlines, or get reminders, Shrimp has you covered.
1. **Ensure Java 17 or Above**: Verify that Java is installed and added to your path by running `java --version` in your terminal.
2. **Download**: Obtain the latest release of Shrimp from [GitHub Releases](https://github.com/RadieonAjax/ip/releases).
4. **Explore Commands**: Use the [commands overview](#commands-overview) to familiarize yourself with available commands.
> The format is given as it is. You should replace the text in `<...>` with the parameters you intend to use.
- **Description**: Lists all tasks currently in the task list.
- **Description**: Adds a new Todo task with the given description.
- **Description**: Adds a new Deadline task with the given description and due date/time.
- **Description**: Adds a new Event task with the given description, start date/time, and end date/time.
- **Description**: Marks the specified task as done.
- **Description**: Unmarks the specified task, marking it as not done.
- **Description**: Deletes the specified task from the task list.
- **Description**: Clears all tasks from the task list.
- **Description**: Finds and lists tasks containing the specified keyword.
The Shrimp chatbot handles several common errors:
- **Invalid command format**: Missing or incorrect parameters, special characters.
- **Data integrity issues**: Invalid date/time formats, etc.
If you have any questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Enjoy using Shrimp!
* The {@code Shrimp} class serves as the entry point for the Shrimp chatbot application.
* It handles the main program flow, including user interaction, task management,

*

The Shrimp chatbot allows users to manage a list of tasks through various commands,
* such as adding, deleting, marking tasks as complete, and searching for tasks.
* The application also supports deadlines and events with time ranges.

* The Launcher class is the entry point to the application.
* It is responsible for launching the JavaFX application.

* It launches the JavaFX application by calling {@link Application#launch(Class, String...)}.
* @param args The command-line arguments passed to the program.

* It is responsible for loading the main application window and setting up the GUI.

* It sets up the main application window by loading the FXML layout,
* configuring the scene, and displaying the stage.

* This method is called when the application is closed.
* It ensures that tasks are saved before the application exits.
* The MainWindow class is responsible for handling the GUI interactions in the Shrimp chatbot application.
* It manages user input, bot responses, and the layout of the dialog boxes.
* Binds the scrollPane to automatically scroll down as new dialog is added to the dialog container.
* Injects the Shrimp instance into the MainWindow and displays the welcome message.
* If an error occurs during startup, it is displayed in the dialog container.

* Represents a task with a deadline.

* @param description The description of the task.
* @param deadline    The date and time by which the task should be completed.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDateTime deadline, boolean isDone) {
* Marks this task as done and returns a new {@code Deadline} instance with the updated status.
* @return A new {@code Deadline} instance marked as done.

* @return A new {@code Deadline} instance marked as not done.
* Returns the type of the task.
* @return A string representing the type of the task, "[D]" for Deadline.
* Retrieves the date and time by which this task should be completed.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including the due date.
* @return A string in the format "[D][status] description (by: MMM dd yyyy)".
* Represents a task that occurs during a specific time period.
* An {@code Event} task has a description, a start time, an end time, and a completion status.
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the specified description, start time, end time, and completion status.
* @param description  The description of the task.
* @param eventStart   The start time of the event.
* @param eventEnd     The end time of the event.
* @param hasCompleted The completion status of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime eventStart, LocalDateTime eventEnd, Boolean hasCompleted) {
* Marks this task as done and returns a new {@code Event} instance with the updated status.
* @return A new {@code Event} instance marked as done.
return new Event(getDescription(), this.eventStart, this.eventEnd, true);
* Marks this task as not done and returns a new {@code Event} instance with the updated status.
* @return A new {@code Event} instance marked as not done.
return new Event(getDescription(), this.eventStart, this.eventEnd, false);
* Returns the type of the task.
* @return A string representing the type of the task, "[E]" for Event.
* Retrieves the start time of this event.
* @return The start time of the event.
* Retrieves the end time of this event.
* @return The end time of the event.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including the start and end times.
* @return A string in the format "[E][status] description (from: dd/MM/yyyy to: dd/MM/yyyy)".
* Represents an abstract task with a description and a completion status.
* Subclasses of {@code Task} must implement methods to mark the task as done or not done, and
* to return the type of the task.
private final String description; //description of the task
private final Boolean isDone; //boolean value for whether it's done or not
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description and completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.
* Retrieves a string representation of the task's completion status.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise " ".
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns whether the task is completed.
* @return {@code true} if the task is done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return A string in the format "[status] description".
* Marks this task as done and returns a new instance with the updated status.
* @return A new {@code Task} instance marked as done.
* Marks this task as not done and returns a new instance with the updated status.
* @return A new {@code Task} instance marked as not done.
* Returns the type of the task.
* @return A string representing the type of the task.

* Replaces the task at the specified index with a new task.

* @param newTask The new task to replace the old task.

* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Returns an iterator over the tasks in the list.
* @return An {@code Iterator} over the tasks in the list.

* The {@code Parser} class provides methods to parse user commands and format date-time strings.
* It includes an enum {@code CommandType} to represent the different types of commands supported by the application.
* Enum representing the various command types that can be parsed from user input.
LIST, BYE, MARK, UNMARK, ADD, DEADLINE, EVENT, ERROR, DELETE, CLEAR, FIND
* A {@code DateTimeFormatter} instance that defines a flexible pattern for parsing and formatting

*

The supported format is {@code day/month/year} with optional time components {@code HH:mm} or {@code HHmm}.
* Defaults to midnight if no time is provided.
public static final DateTimeFormatter PATTERN = new DateTimeFormatterBuilder()

* The {@code Ui} class handles interactions with the user.
* It provides methods to display various messages and prompt the user for input.
* Initializes the scanner to read user input from the console.
* Returns a welcome message to greet the user.
* @return A welcome message as a {@code String}.
String greetings = "Domo! Same desu~ I am shrimp, and I am happy to assist you! Hewwo? <3";
* Returns an exit message to be displayed when the user ends the session.
* @return An exit message as a {@code String}.
String exit = "Byebye~ It's time to say goodbye for the day~ Hope you enjoyed and had fuuun~ "
* Returns a formatted string listing all tasks in the provided {@code TaskList}.
* Each task is displayed with an index.

* @return A formatted string with all tasks and the task count.
String output = "Gotchaaa~ Here's the list so far:";
* Returns a string indicating the number of tasks in the provided {@code TaskList}.
* @param taskList The {@code TaskList} containing the tasks to be counted.
* @return A string with the task count.
